attributes.action: Protecting Pangolins from extinction and encourage conservation strategies
attributes.additional_details: Governments have a responsibility to uphold environmental sustainability, ensuring future generations inherit thriving ecosystems. Beyond ecological benefits, conservation creates economic opportunities through ecotourism and scientific research. Investing in education and policy enforcement safeguards biodiversity while reinforcing ethical responsibility in conservation efforts worldwide. https://www.thepangolinproject.org
attributes.background: Governments must act to protect pangolins, vital for ecosystem balance. Strengthen anti-poaching laws, enhance habitat conservation, curb trafficking, and educate to reduce demand, ensuring their survival.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about poaching, habitat conservation and trafficking of pangolins are a matter for authorities in countries where pangolins are native. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the UK Government or Parliament to do.
